Hi Juergen,

as far as I know the AdaptiveRevisitFrontier
is broken in Heritrix 2.X. Adaptive revisit was an experiment for
Heritrix 1.0x and is in the current code for reference only, I think.
I don't know if there is a chance to get it working. Currently there
seems to be no active maintainer. There has been some more details about
this in the mailinglist some days ago. Currently I can't find it, but
you may have a look at the archive at
http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/ to get more details.


Christian


Juergen Umbrich schrieb:
> Hi
> 
> I tried to start a crawl-job with Heritirx 2.0.1 and the 
> AdaptiveRevisitFrontier
> but unfortunately I run into some NullPointerExceptions (the sheet 
> config is the basic-sheet config, just edited the Frontier)
> 
> 09-Oct-2008 16:59:10 org.archive.settings.jmx.LoggingDynamicMBean 
> dealWithException
> SEVERE: ReflectionException during requestCrawlStart (in thread 'Thread-11')
> java.lang.NullPointerException
>     at 
> org.archive.crawler.frontier.AdaptiveRevisitFrontier.loadSeeds(AdaptiveRevisitFrontier.java:240)
> 
> Had someone else the same exception, while starting to run a revisiting 
> crawl?
> Or can anyone send me a working sheet that supports 
> incremental/revisiting crawling ?
> 
> 
> 
> Best
> juergen
>
